snpGeneSets 2.0
  • Reference

Build pathway annotation database from MSigDB gene sets

msigdb_build.Rd

The function parses GMT files of MSigDB gene sets V6.1, downloaded from the MSigDB web site of Broad Institute, and builds a locally integrated pathway annotation database for snpGeneSets package to support two-way mapping between genes and pathways and pathway enrichment analysis I and II.

Usage

msigdb_build(gmt_dir)

Arguments

gmt_dir

A character variable specifies the directory for GMT files of MSigDB gene sets V6.1

Details

The function parses 41 GMT files from 8 major gene-set categories (including the "H: hallmark gene sets") for MSigDB 6.1, and build a locally integrated pathway database for two-way mapping between genes and pathways and pathway enrichment analysis I and II. The function classifies gene sets into total 21 categories that have the type ID, 'setType', from 0 to 20, based on classification of MSigDB Collections. To simplify the reference of MSigDB gene sets, the function assigns a unique number for every gene set, which is labeled as 'PID' and directly used for annotation and enrichment analysis.

The data of gene sets can be downloaded at: http://software.broadinstitute.org/gsea/msigdb/download_file.jsp?filePath=/resources/msigdb/6.1/msigdb_v6.1_files_to_download_locally.zip

Value

References

http://www.broadinstitute.org/gsea/downloads.jsp

Author

H Mei; L Li

Note

See also

getSetType, getSetGenes, setID2setType, setType2setID,enrichTest1, enrichTest2

Examples

# gmt_dir="C:/tmp/msigdb_v6.1_files_to_download_locally/msigdb_v6.1_GMTs"
# msigdb_build(gmt_dir)
